Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body a pale-red pottery vessel, interior slightly grooved and covered with bands of a white deposit, exterior covered with a cream-coloured slip and with remains of two lines of thickly painted black hieratic text identifying the contents as year 10 wine of the aten domain from the western river.
Curator's comments: Peet & Woolley, City of Akhenaten I. Pl. LXIV fig. 10
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393143) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393143)
Associated places: Named in inscription: Domain of Aten
